text: Visit my website to learn more about the nomination process: valadao.house.gov/services/a…

This week, my office hosted a Service Academy Information Night at the Porterville Military Academy. It’s encouraging that there are so many young people in the Central Valley interested in military service at our nation’s Service Academies. #CA22

I'm frustrated that a handful of Republicans joined with all House Democrats to essentially bring our government to a halt. Now, instead of using our limited time to fund the government and secure the border, this sideshow has become the main event.

Update from the House Floor: Democrats are stalling this current vote to ensure Gaetz has all democrats in attendance to help him try to oust McCarthy. Why would a Republican work only with Democrats to oust our Republican Speaker?
Removing a Republican Speaker only undermines the causes my colleague from Florida claims to support. I stand with my friend @SpeakerMcCarthy.
The overwhelming majority of our conference supports @SpeakerMcCarthy. The irony of Matt Gaetz’s stunt is that he would have to rely on democratic votes to succeed.

This motion to vacate is politics at its worst. Nothing more than grandstanding for political gain and a distraction from the real work we have to do for the American people. 

Proud to stand with my friend @SpeakerMcCarthy
Don’t forget! My team is hosting a Service Academy Information Night tonight from 6-8 p.m. at the Porterville Military Academy. Make sure to RSVP here: valadao.house.gov/services/a…

Under @SpeakerMcCarthy’s leadership, House Republicans have passed legislation to boost energy production, secure the border, and cut wasteful spending.

Attempting to remove the Speaker is nothing more than a personal vendetta & a distraction from our work to deliver results.
This is not a time for political games. The American people want us to keep the government open and finish our work on the appropriations bills.
The House just passed a 45-day Continuing Resolution to keep the government open while we continue our work to pass fiscally responsible government funding bills. My full statement:

Democrats just motioned to adjourn the House until Monday - the government shuts down at midnight tonight. 

House Democrats would rather shut the government down than vote for a clean CR with disaster funding.

If you have questions, reach out to my office at 202-225-4695.
 
You can find answers to frequently asked questions on my website here: valadao.house.gov/services/g…

We just had an opportunity to pass a short term funding bill that would’ve given us more time to find agreement on spending levels and secured the border. Sadly, it failed.

As we get closer to the 9/30 deadline, I wanted to give you another update on where things stand:

🚨 I just sent a newsletter update on where things stand on government funding. Read my newsletter & share your thoughts about the possible government shutdown: 
valadao.house.gov/news/email…

Deeply saddened to learn our senior Senator from California, Dianne Feinstein, has passed away. She was a trailblazer and dedicated her life to public service. My thoughts are with her family, staff, and everyone who knew her during this difficult time.
The House just passed another 3 appropriations bills. My full statement:
I’ll continue working on a path forward on government funding that reduces wasteful federal spending, secures the border, and keeps the government open.

The Fresh Produce Procurement Reform Act would make it easier for food-insecure families to access fresh produce, and open new markets for our farmers. This is a commonsense bill that’s good for the Valley.

It’s National Clean Energy Week! This week, we celebrate all the different ways we power the Valley & our country. Whether it’s natural gas, hydro, nuclear, solar, or wind power, I’m proud to support an all-of-the-above energy approach to reduce costs for Valley families. #NCEW23
I know there’s a lot of frustration out there about a potential government shutdown, and I’m frustrated too. Here’s an update on where things stand in Washington this week:

I’m proud to support the Invest to Protect Act, which would provide grants for mental health services, treatments and therapy for the police officers of small communities like ours. If you or a loved one need help, call 9-8-8 or visit nami.org/988

Today is National Law Enforcement Suicide Awareness Day. Our officers answer traumatic calls, including homicides, child abuse and domestic violence. We need to prioritize their mental health and make sure we are giving them the resources they need to do these difficult jobs.

I support Canada and their full investigation into the assassination of Hardeep Singh Nijjar.

As co-chair of the Sikh Caucus, I will continue to monitor this crime and ensure accountability.

September is #SuicidePreventionMonth. Take a moment to check in on yourself and your loved ones, and remember that you are not alone. If someone is showing warning signs, urge them to contact a mental health professional or call 9-8-8 or visit nami.org/988.

Proud to introduce the Fresh Produce Procurement Reform Act alongside @rosadelauro and @SenSherrodBrown. This bipartisan bill will expand access to fresh produce for food insecure residents throughout the Central Valley. 

Read more: valadao.house.gov/news/docum…
The American people don’t want a government shutdown, they want us to pass government funding bills and do our jobs. We need to stop wasting time and start moving funding bills forward.

I strongly condemn the large-scale attack by Azerbaijani forces today. President Aliyev orchestrated this deliberate attack to exile the Armenian population in Artsakh. The U.S. should use every diplomatic tool to help guarantee their right to remain there
valadao.house.gov/news/docum…

Last week one of our summer interns, Braiden, swore his Oath of Enlistment for the U.S. Navy nuclear program. Congratulations Braiden, and thank you for your service to our country. #TeamValadao is proud!

Fue un placer asistir a las celebraciones del Día de la Independencia de México en el Consulado mexicano y presentar un Acta del Congreso agradeciendo al consulado por su importante trabajo ayudando a los inmigrantes mexicanos en el Valle Central.

Great to attend the Mexican Independence Day celebrations at the Consulate of Mexico and present a Congressional Record thanking the consulate for their important work assisting Mexican immigrants in the Central Valley.

Happy Birthday to the @usairforce! For 76 years, the brave men and women of the U.S. Air Force have protected our nation from the skies. To all those who make up our Air Force, past and present – thank you for your dedication and service to our country!

Happy Constitution Day and Citizenship Day! On this day, 236 years ago, our founding fathers signed what would become the longest-serving Constitution in history and a symbol of democracy around the world 🇺🇸

Hoy comienza el Mes de la Herencia Hispana: una gran oportunidad para reconocer las contribuciones que las generaciones de hispanoamericanos hacen en nuestras comunidades cada día. Estoy orgulloso de representar a una de las comunidades hispanas más grandes en el Congreso.

Today marks the beginning of Hispanic Heritage Month – a great opportunity to recognize the many contributions generations of Hispanic Americans make in our communities every single day. I’m proud to represent one of the largest Hispanic communities in Congress.
The @dodpaa  needs help from families of unaccounted for troops in identifying remains. Visit their website to learn more: dpaa.mil/

I recently visited the Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency in Hawaii to learn more about ongoing work to locate and return POWs and those missing in action. Thank you to the personnel at @dodpaa for their tireless efforts on behalf of our servicemembers & their families.
Today on POW/MIA Recognition Day, join me in taking a moment to remember all those who never made it home from their service. The service and sacrifice of these men and women will never be forgotten.

🚨 The House just voted to overturn California’s harmful electric vehicle mandates. 

Earlier this year, I led my colleagues in opposing these mandates that will further stress our electrical grid and increase our reliance on China for critical minerals.
foxnews.com/politics/republi…

Issuing this subpoena is an important first step in getting to the bottom of the illegal Reedley lab. Valley residents and the American people deserve answers, and I’ll continue to support the committee’s bipartisan investigation. 
sjvsun.com/u-s/house-china-s…
Just wrapped up another great telephone town hall. Thank you to all who joined! #CA22

I participated in a Valley Fever Task Force Roundtable with our Co-Chairs @SpeakerMcCarthy & @RepDavid, as well as leading experts in the field to hear about ongoing challenges to vaccine development and how we can work together to find solutions to this disease.
Don’t forget! Tonight at 6:00 pm PT, I’m hosting a telephone town hall to answer your questions on my work for #CA22. Sign up here: valadao.house.gov/live

🚨 The House just passed my bill, the Wildfire Fighting Technology Act, with unanimous support. 

This bill will help deploy new technologies to combat and contain devastating wildfires in a quicker, more efficient way.

No better way to start my week in D.C. than welcoming veterans to the U.S. Capitol for the Central Valley Honor Flight. These patriots risked their lives to keep our nation safe, and I was honored to be able to thank them in person for their service.
This Wednesday, September 13th I’ll be hosting a tele-town hall to answer your questions about my work in Washington on behalf of #CA22. Sign up here: valadao.house.gov/live/

September 11, 2001, changed our nation forever. Today, we remember those who tragically lost their lives, the bravery of the first responders who answered the call to help, and the resiliency of the American people as we recovered from this horrific day. 

We will #NeverForget

Want to keep up on my work in Congress?

Sign up for my weekly e-newsletter to get updates directly to your inbox each Friday. You can sign up by visiting: valadao.house.gov/forms/emai…

Many areas in #CA22 rely on rural health clinics for vital care.  I’m proud to co-sponsor the bipartisan Rural Health Clinic Burden Reduction Act, which would remove outdated regulations and provide more flexibility for these providers.

Earlier this year, I hosted @HouseAgGOP in Tulare for a Farm Bill listening session to ensure Central Valley voices were heard.

I’ll continue working to ensure our community has the resources we need in the Farm Bill to provide food for the nation.

bakersfield.com/opinion/comm…

One of the best parts of my job is welcoming constituents from the Valley to our nation’s capital. 

If you’re planning a trip to DC, visit Valadao.house.gov/forms/tour… or call (202) 225-4695 so my office can help.

The Congressional App Challenge is back! If you’re a middle or high school student interested in STEM, you can sign up for the challenge today.
 
The deadline to submit your finished app is November 1st. For more information and to register, visit congressionalappchallenge.us

California is no stranger to devastating wildfires, but it doesn’t have to be this way.

Better forest management is key to reducing the intensity and impact of wildfires in our state. Read more⬇️
fresnobee.com/opinion/reader…
Happy Labor Day! Meeting with the hard-working people of the Central Valley is one of the best parts of my job.

The @NatResources field hearing in Yosemite made one thing clear: We need improved forest management now. This is a critical step to reducing the intensity of California wildfires and providing cleaner air for the Valley.

Read more in my latest op-ed:
fresnobee.com/opinion/reader…
It was great to attend the Tachi Pow Wow last weekend – a celebration of the rich history and culture of the Tachi Yokut Tribe. Thank you to all those involved for putting on such a fun event!

Had a productive meeting with the city manager and mayor pro tem of Arvin last week to talk about expanding wastewater infrastructure & other upcoming projects. It’s always helpful to meet with our local leaders to get updates on what resources they need & how my office can help.

We need to be proactive about fixing our water storage and infrastructure issues so that we are better prepared for these kinds of weather events and resilient to periods of drought.
thehill.com/opinion/congress…

Yes, we’ve said this for years – California needs to build more water storage.

There was an immeasurable amount of water that was flushed out to the ocean because we didn’t have the capacity to capture & store it for dry years.
latimes.com/california/story…

I met with Arvin Police Chief Alex Ghazalpour and participated in a ride-along to see firsthand some of the challenges our officers are facing. We need to ensure law enforcement has the resources they need to combat fentanyl, reduce violent crime, and keep our communities safe.🚔

Terra and I are keeping @SteveScalise and his family in our prayers as he fights his battle against cancer. Steve is a fighter, and I have full confidence that he will overcome this challenge with the same strength and perseverance as he has all others.

KERN & TULARE COUNTY: The deadline to apply for FEMA disaster assistance is this Friday, September 1st.

Visit disasterassistnace.gov or call @FEMA at (800) 621-3362 to apply.

I was honored to attend the unveiling of the new Larry Hallum Library at Arvin High School & present a Congressional Record honoring his life to his wife, Brenda. Larry’s service to our community and dedication to the students of Arvin will always be remembered.
We will not stop demanding accountability from this administration on the chaotic withdrawal that resulted in this loss of life.

Please join me in remembering the 13 American service members who made the ultimate sacrifice 2 years ago during the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan. Today I’m praying for the families and loved ones of our fallen heroes.

Farmers are still dealing with damages caused by recent storms & flooding. I stopped at J Milicic & Sons Farms and Storage to discuss the impact of this weather on the table grape industry in the Valley. I’ll continue working to get our community the resources we need to recover.

Yesterday I participated in a ride along with Bakersfield Mayor @karenkgoh and the city manager to tour the area of the MLK Jr. Blvd Complete Streets Project. This is a much-needed project that will improve the safety, economic development, and accessibility of the area.

Great to tour @cencalfoodbank, the Valley’s largest hunger relief organization that provides support and resources to over 310,000 Valley residents a month. We discussed their operations & the importance of strengthening anti-hunger programs in the upcoming Farm Bill.

Had a great meeting with ASV Wines in McFarland recently. We toured their bottling & Aptco facilities and discussed the capabilities of expanded polystyrene, the upcoming Farm Bill, and some of the biggest issues impacting local farmers. Thanks to the team for a great tour!
Incredibly sorry to hear about the loss of @RepVanOrden’s daughter, Sydney. Terra and I are keeping the Van Orden family in our prayers during this difficult time.

A new @SBAgov Disaster Loan Outreach Center is open at Corcoran City Hall to assist those who need help navigating available federal disaster loan applications. The center is open until Friday 8/25.

City Hall Conference Room
832 Whitley Ave
Corcoran, CA 93212

Today is National Fentanyl Prevention & Awareness Day.

Fentanyl continues to harm families and communities across the Central Valley. I voted to make Fentanyl a Schedule 1 drug to give law enforcement the tools they need to combat this epidemic.

There’s a possibility of excessive rainfall this weekend. Make sure to stay informed and sign up for emergency alerts from your county:

Kings: kingsoes.com/alert

Kern: kerncountyfire.org/education…

Tulare: oes.tularecounty.ca.gov/oes/

It was great to be in Stratford to visit @SOLVenergyteam  & tour their solar farms here in the Central Valley. The only way to ensure American energy independence is through empowering all means of production – including solar. Thank you to the team at SOLV for a great tour!

The red tape that makes it difficult for land managers to confront the threat of wildfires are the same regulations that restrict us from properly managing our waterways in the Valley to prevent devastating flooding.

Today marks 2 years since the chaotic U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan. The Biden administration must be held accountable for their reckless foreign policy decision that left American citizens and allies stranded and resulted in the loss of 13 U.S. service members.

Thank you to our Hanford office intern David for all of his hard work this summer serving #CA22! 

Internships are a great way to learn more about government. If you’re interested in interning in my district or DC offices, find more information here: valadao.house.gov/internship…
Proper forest management is key to preventing some of the catastrophic wildfires we’ve seen in California that have devastated people’s livelihoods, homes, and businesses.

Last week I participated in a field tour & hearing on wildfires and forest management with @NatResources and @WesternCaucs in Yosemite. Thank you to Chairman @RepWesterman & @RepNewhouse for bringing members from across the country to California to learn more about these issues.
Honored to be a part of the @NatResources Committee’s first outdoor hearing right in our own back yard - Yosemite.
My Bakersfield office is currently experiencing a power outage. If you need immediate assistance from my team, call the Hanford office at 559-460-6070

The discovery of the illegal medical lab in Reedley is extremely concerning. I support a congressional investigation to provide people with answers and ensure these kinds of labs are not operating in other parts of the country.
kget.com/news/california-new…

#CA22 veterans – don’t forget to apply for PACT Act benefits before tomorrow, 8/9 to be eligible for backdated benefits to August 10, 2022.

💻Visit VA.gov/PACT
☎️Call the PACT Act hotline at 800-698-2411

Today I toured the Diablo Canyon Power Plant, which provides safe, clean energy to millions of Californians. 

An all-of-the-above approach to energy production and use, including nuclear, is critical to lowering costs, creating jobs, and strengthening our national security.
Our farmworkers play an essential role in feeding America. Thank you to the farmworkers across the Central Valley who help put food on tables across the country. #FarmWorkerAppreciationDay

Programs like Conrad 30 play a critical role in addressing physician shortages. This bill aims to bring more healthcare professionals to our rural communities to ensure people get the care they need.
bakersfield.com/news/valadao…

#CA22 veterans: Apply for your expanded benefits under the PACT Act before August 9th to be eligible for retroactive compensation. Learn more about what benefits may be available to you at VA.gov/PACT or call the PACT Act hotline at 800-698-2411.
Read more about the bill here: valadao.house.gov/news/docum…

Doctor shortages have hurt Valley communities for years, leaving many to drive hours for care or forego it altogether. I’m proud to introduce the Conrad State 30 and Physician Reauthorization Act to bring more doctors to rural areas and help people get the basic care they need.
Read more about the Specialty Crop Domestic Market Promotion Program Act and the Specialty Crop Mechanization Assistance Act: valadao.house.gov/news/docum…

Specialty crop producers have faced many challenges over the last few years – from supply chain backlogs to rising input costs.

This week I introduced two bills to support our specialty crop industry so these producers can access new markets & remain competitive.

Proud to introduce the REAP Modernization Act with @RepSpanberger to make this popular program more responsive to the needs of Central Valley communities.

This bill makes it easier for rural small businesses and farmers to take advantage of REAP & lower their energy costs.

Today is #NationalInternDay. Thank you to our #TeamValadao DC and district office summer interns for all of their hard work and dedication to serving #CA22. If you’re interested in interning in my D.C. or district offices, visit my website:  Valadao.house.gov/internship…

#CA22 veterans: If you qualify for expanded benefits under the PACT Act, apply before August 9, 2023, to be eligible for retroactive benefits backdated to August 10, 2022.

Visit VA.gov/PACT to apply
Call my office at (559) 460-6070 if you need assistance
Our farmers are the best stewards of our environment, and equipping them with the best available technology is good for the industry and our environment. Read more: valadao.house.gov/news/docum…
We have a methane digester on our dairy, which turns cow manure into biogas. It's a pretty cool way to manage waste and produce renewable energy. 🐮
Proud to join @RepJimCosta to introduce the #COWSAct to make environmentally-friendly manure management technology more accessible for the livestock industry.

Our veterans learn a wide variety of critical skills during their service – many of which are applicable to all kinds of industries in #CA22. If you’re an employer looking to fill an open position – consider looking to our nation’s veterans. #NationalHireAVeteranDay

Housing affordability continues to be a huge issue for Central Valley families. I’m proud to be a co-sponsor of the Neighborhood Homes Investment Act – a bipartisan bill that encourages additional investments in new & rehabilitated housing to make home ownership more feasible.

NEW: The deadline to apply for FEMA & SBA relief for those impacted by winter storms and flooding has been extended. You now have until SEPTEMBER 1, 2023 to apply.

Visit DisasterAssistance.gov or call 800-621-3362 to learn more.

Today I voted for the Securing Growth and Robust Leadership in American Aviation Act. This bipartisan reauthorization of the @FAANews will address staff shortages to reduce delays, invest in our small & rural airports, & preserve America’s gold standard in aviation safety.
Fentanyl is one of the biggest threats to our communities. We should be giving law enforcement every tool available to hold those who distribute this deadly drug accountable.

Always great to join @KMPHFOX26 to give #CA22 an update on my work in Washington. Today we talked about addressing labor shortages in the Valley, the passage of the NDAA and how it helps our local service members and NAS Lemoore, and the Farm Workforce Modernization Act. Watch:

I strongly condemn the recent hateful and anti-Israel rhetoric from some of my Democratic colleagues. Last night, I was proud to vote in support of a pro-Israel resolution that condemned antisemitism and confirmed the strong partnership between our countries.

Looking forward to attending Israeli President Isaac Herzog’s joint address to Congress this morning. 🇺🇸 🇮🇱

I will always stand with our ally Israel and support the continued friendship between our two countries.

Watch the address here: speaker.gov/live/

Proud to be an original co-sponsor of the #HIREAct.

Labor shortages are having a devastating impact on industries throughout the Valley. Improving our temporary work visa programs will help reform our broken immigration system & ensure employers can fill these essential roles.

#CA22: ¡No lo olvides! Si fue afectado por tormentas de invierno e inundaciones, el último día para solicitar asistencia por desastre con FEMA o SBA es en 2 días: 20 de julio de 2023.

Visite: DisasterAssistance.gov/es
Llame: 800-621-3362

#CA22: Don’t forget! If you were impacted by winter storms and flooding, the last day to apply for disaster assistance with FEMA or SBA is in 2 days – July 20, 2023.

Visit: DisasterAssistance.gov
Call: 800-621-3362

It’s a top priority of mine to ensure the Central Valley has the resources we need to continue growing the food that feeds the nation and much of the world. Read my latest opinion piece in the @BakersfieldCali about my priorities for the Farm Bill:
bakersfield.com/opinion/comm…

Just stopped by the blood drive in Visalia to donate! Stop by 700 East Mineral King Avenue today between 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. if you’re able to donate to help with the blood shortages throughout the Valley.

Today the House voted to give our troops the largest pay increase in 20 years & provide our military the equipment, resources, and training they need to protect our nation. I look forward to working with the Senate to strengthen the FY24 NDAA through the conference process.

Va a ser un fin de semana muy caluroso en el Valle Central. Manténgase seguro y encuentre los centros de enfriamiento disponibles para su condado aquí:

Kings: 211kingscounty.org/housing/w…

Kern: kerncounty.com/government/ag…

Tulare: tularecounty.ca.gov/emergenc…

It’s going to be a hot weekend in the Valley. Stay safe and find available cooling centers for your county below:
 
Kings: 211kingscounty.org/housing/w…

Kern: kerncounty.com/government/ag…

Tulare: tularecounty.ca.gov/emergenc…

We need to make it easier for young people to enter the ag industry. That’s why I’m supporting the Crop Insurance for Future Farmers Act, which will expand crop insurance access for new farmers & ensure we’re able to feed the world for generations to come.

I was honored to receive the Champion of Healthcare Innovation award today at the @HealthInFocus Innovation Expo. It was great to stop by a few booths to learn more about the technology being used to support better health outcomes in our communities.

Busy week ahead for @HouseAppropsGOP as we continue our work on marking up the FY24 appropriations bills. Making sure the Central Valley has a seat at the table in determining how your tax dollars are spent is a responsibility I take very seriously.

Every day is #CowAppreciationDay on the dairy farm! 🐄

There are over 1.7 million milk cows who call California home & produce the dairy products we all know and love.

Central Valley farm workers play an essential role in feeding America. The Farm Workforce Modernization Act makes important reforms to the H-2A program to ensure farmers have access to a legal and reliable workforce.
bakersfieldnow.com/news/loca…

Don’t forget: the FEMA and SBA application deadline for damage caused by winter storms and flooding is July 20, 2023.

Visit the @SBAgov website for more information about how to apply: disasterloanassistance.sba.g…

Food security is national security, and agricultural labor shortages threaten our ability to grow food for the nation. Proud to join my colleagues to reintroduce the bipartisan Farm Workforce Modernization Act. Read more: valadao.house.gov/news/docum…
Happy Independence Day #CA22 🇺🇸

The wellbeing of our neighbors is dependent on blood donors, and donating blood is simple, easy, and essential. The nation & the Central Valley are experiencing a shortage of blood and platelets. If you’re able to, find a location and make an appointment: donateblood.org

Californians are already paying $1.28 more per gallon than the national average – but today the gas tax is increasing by 4 cents per gallon. 

I led my colleagues in opposing this increase and demanding relief for Central Valley families.

The Kern and Kings Rivers are especially dangerous this year due to increased water levels & faster-flowing water from the snowpack melt. Stay safe this holiday weekend and stay out of the rivers. If you’re near the water, follow these safety tips:
kerncounty.com/Home/Componen…

I led the entire California Republican delegation in urging @GavinNewsom to change course on raising the gas tax. This tax increase is going to make it even more expensive for hardworking Valley families to make ends meet. Read more in @SJVSun: sjvsun.com/california/valada…

Gas prices in California continue to be some of the highest in the country. This increase is going to put another burden on people in the Central Valley who are already dealing with the high cost of living in our state.
sjvsun.com/business/energy/c…

Glad to meet with the Bakersfield College Delano Campus leadership team to learn more about their Rural Initiatives Program & get a tour of the campus. It’s important that we work together to expand educational pathways and career training opportunities for our rural communities.

PTSD affects millions of Americans, including our service members, veterans, and first responders. If you’re struggling with PTSD, you’re not alone. #PTSDAwarenessDay

Call 988 for help or visit ptsd.va.gov/gethelp/find_the…

Today I toured the @SJVC Delano campus and had the opportunity to learn more about the school’s nursing program. As we see nursing shortages across our rural communities, it’s great to see how SJVC’s program is helping to increase the amount of nurses here in the Valley.

This morning I attended the Ground Breaking of the International Agri-Center Interchange Project. This long-awaited expansion of the Commercial Avenue interchange will improve the flow of traffic around the @IntlAgriCenter and contribute to economic development in our community.

Congratulations to our #CA22 Congressional Art Competition winner, Laci from Bakersfield. Her work, titled “The Flow”, will be displayed for one year in the halls of the U.S. Capitol. Way to make the Central Valley proud!

The @HouseAppropsGOP Committee just passed our FY24 Energy & Water Bill out of a full committee markup. 
 
Provisions I secured in the bill will help increase water storage, streamline operations, and bring much-needed accountability to the way water is managed in California.
Congratulations to Fresno native Lynn Williams for representing the Central Valley on #TeamUSA! Looking forward to cheering on the @USWNT at the 2023 Women’s World Cup. ⚽🇺🇸

The current H-2A program's limitation to seasonal employment leaves farmers without the stable workforce that is vital to our food supply chain.

Expanding the program to include year-round employment would ease labor shortages & allow farmers to grow food that feeds the nation.

#CA22: Did you know you can sign up for text alerts from my office to stay up to date? 

Just text ‘VALADAO’ to 559-387-4346 to sign up for important updates.

On #Juneteenth, we celebrate the end of slavery in the United States. On this day in 1865 the last slaves in Galveston, Texas learned that they had been freed from the bonds of slavery – nearly two and a half years after the signing of the Emancipation Proclamation.
Of all the jobs I have, being a father is by far my favorite. To all the dads across #CA22 and the nation – Happy Father’s Day!

Proud to join @RepJimCosta to introduce the Headwaters Protection Act.

This bipartisan bill updates the Water Source Protection Program to ensure our Central Valley communities who are often forced to rely on surface & groundwater have access to safe, clean, and reliable water.

I worked to secure language in the @HouseAppropsGOP FY24 Ag bill that recognizes the effects of recent storms on California’s ag sector & directs the use of all available disaster response measures quickly & effectively. Ensuring #CA22 has the resources we need is my top priority

No olvide que la fecha límite para solicitar asistencia por desastre se ha extendido hasta el 20 de julio. @SBAgov y @FEMA estarán disponibles en los centros móviles de recursos para desastres en #CA22 este mes. Este es un gran recurso si necesita ayuda con su solicitud.

#CA22: Don’t forget the deadline to apply for disaster assistance has been extended to July 20th. Reps from @SBAgov & @FEMA will be available at Mobile Disaster Resource Centers in Tulare County this month. This is a great resource if you need help with your application. ⬇️

For 248 years, the men and women of the United States Army have bravely defended freedom here at home and around the world. Today, I want to wish a very happy birthday to @USArmy and thank all its members for their commitment to service and our nation 🇺🇸
Had fun playing in the Congressional Soccer Game last night hosted by the @ussoccerfndn to help support youth soccer programs across the country. Republicans won 4-2! ⚽️

Today I introduced the Combatting Substance Use Disorder Act. This bill helps to inform Congress, public health experts, and Medicaid providers about how to best meet the needs of individuals struggling with substance abuse. 

Read more: valadao.house.gov/news/docum…

The Stars and Stripes represent more than just a country - they are a symbol of freedom and democracy throughout the world. Today, we celebrate #FlagDay to honor our great American flag and all that it represents 🇺🇸

Today, @NatResources moved my bill, the Emergency Wildfire Fighting Technology Act, out of a full committee markup. This bipartisan bill ensures firefighters have the most up-to-date technology to combat California wildfires and keep our communities safe.

The @FHFA’s new mandated changes to mortgage pricing unfairly penalize borrowers with higher credit scores. I'm proud to co-sponsor the Middle-Class Borrower Protection Act to ensure Valley families aren’t forced to pay higher fees for having a good credit score.

Want to stay up to date on my work in Washington on behalf of #CA22? Sign up for my weekly e-newsletter for updates straight to your inbox every Friday: valadao.house.gov/forms/emai…

Catch up on previous newsletters here: valadao.house.gov/news/email…

I had a great time welcoming Shafter’s Richland Junior High School to the Capitol and showing them one of my favorite views of Washington!

If you are coming to DC and want to tour the Capitol building, visit my website at valadao.house.gov/forms/tour…

California is home to over 1.7 million dairy cows - 80% of which live in the Central Valley. During #NationalDairyMonth, join me in raising a glass to America’s dairy farmers who help supply our nation with the dairy products we all know and love 🐄🥛
Had a great time speaking to a group of young cooperators at @NMPF’s dairy policy and legislative forum in Washington, DC this morning!

🚨 The deadline to apply for FEMA disaster assistance has been extended to July 20, 2023.

If you’re in Kern or Tulare County and were impacted by the storms & flooding earlier this year, you can apply for FEMA relief today at disasterassistance.gov/ or call 800-621-3362.

79 years ago today, 133,000 brave Allied soldiers stormed the beaches of Normandy to liberate the European continent from Nazi control. On #DDay, we honor those who gave their lives in order to protect freedom and democracy around the world.

It was great to be in Oregon on Friday for a Farm Bill Listening Session with my friend @RepLCD & Chairman of @HouseAgGOP @CongressmanGT. Hearing input from farmers across the country is how we're able to deliver a Farm Bill that reflects the needs of our ag community.

Portuguese Americans have made incredible contributions to our communities in the Valley. Today I introduced a resolution to designate June as Portuguese National Heritage Month to recognize Portuguese Americans who have made a lasting impact on the fabric of our country.
Here are some facts on California dairy in honor of National Dairy Month! Thank you to the dairy farmers in #CA22 for making the milk products we all know and love. 🐄

It’s #WorldMilkDay! California produces the most milk, butter, ice cream & nonfat dry milk of any state in the U.S. As a dairy farmer, I think it's safe to say the best milk comes from California cows. 🐄
 
Today I'm raising a glass of milk to our Central Valley dairy farmers. 🥛

I voted yes on the Fiscal Responsibility Act to avoid a catastrophic default on our debt & reduce the deficit by $2.1 trillion. 

My full statement:

The much-needed reforms secured in the Fiscal Responsibility Act were only possible because @SpeakerMcCarthy & @HouseGOP were united in taking action & forcing @POTUS to the negotiating table.

The bill avoids a catastrophic default while limiting spending and cutting red tape.

Members of my team attended Memorial Day events throughout #CA22, including Bakersfield National Cemetery, Grangeville Cemetery, Hillcrest Memorial, Greenlawn, Historic Union Cemetery, Lindsay-Strathmore Cemetery & the Park at Riverwalk. 

We live free because of the brave. 🇺🇸

On Memorial Day, we pay tribute to the brave men and women of America’s Armed Forces who made the ultimate sacrifice to protect our freedoms and our way of life. These patriots and their families are in my thoughts and prayers this Memorial Day. #CA22
Finished our day at the @LVMPD fusion center to learn about how they’re using technology and information sharing between agencies to prevent targeted violence & assess threats to the community.

Productive stop at Lake Mead Overview & Hoover Dam. 

Discussed water usage in the Colorado River Basin and the ongoing struggle between water use for agricultural and urban areas w/ @usbr, @NatlParkService, and @SNWA_H2O
Our next stop was the Black Fire Innovation Hub at @unlv_oed to learn about their research & development of innovative technologies for the hospitality and entertainment industry  in #NV03

Just finished a tour of @MPMaterials, the only integrated rare earth mining & processing site in the U.S. where 15% of the world’s rare earths are mined. 

They’re on the cutting edge of onshoring our energy supply chain & reducing our reliance on China for these materials.

Building relationships with members across the aisle is how we’re able to find agreement and get things done in Washington. 

Today I’m in @RepSusieLee’s district on a @BPC_Bipartisan Congressional Exchange visit. 

⬇️ ⬇️

Today is National Wine Day! California grows 89% of all US wine, and the Central Valley is California’s largest wine grape producing region, growing more than 1.5 million tons of wine grapes last year. If you’re enjoying a glass of wine today - thank a farmer 🍷

Today is National #MissingChildrensDay – a chance to highlight the importance of child safety and thank the organizations that are dedicated to reuniting missing children with their families – there is no more important mission!

Today, I was proud to vote for the HALT Fentanyl Act to make Fentanyl a Schedule 1 drug. Fentanyl has devastated communities across the country, and this legislation gives law enforcement the tools they need to combat this crisis. valadao.house.gov/news/docum…
Just wrapped up our flood resources tele-town hall. A huge thank you to @Cal_OES, @fema, @SBAgov, and @USDA for joining the call and being a resource for our Central Valley community. #CA22

🚨 #CA22: Tonight I’m hosting a flood resources tele-town hall with representatives from @fema, @USDA, @SBAgov, and @Cal_OES to help answer your questions on flood resources and preparedness. Looking forward to talking to you soon! 

Sign up: Valadao.house.gov/live

The President has been in Washington longer than I’ve been alive. He knows compromise is what this country was built on – and still, he did nothing to come to the table and have a conversation with Republicans on the debt ceiling for nearly 100 days.

Do you have questions about available federal resources & flood response in the Valley? Join me on Wednesday the 24th for a flood resources tele-town hall. I’ll have representatives from @FEMA, @SBAGov, and @USDA on the line to help answer your questions. Valadao.house.gov/live

The Endangered Species Act has been abused by extreme environmentalists to stop the construction of critical water storage infrastructure in the Valley. We must reform the ESA to strike a better balance between protecting our environment & commonsense. #WCSpeciesWeek

House Republicans are the only ones who have taken any action to raise the debt limit. For months, President Biden kicked the can down the road and refused to acknowledge there was a problem.

Now, we are down to the wire because of Biden’s inaction.

On Wednesday, May 24th I’ll be hosting a flood resources tele-town hall to answer your questions about available resources and what’s being done to prepare our communities. 

Sign up for the town hall and stream live here: valadao.house.gov/live/

I was glad to meet with @theopendoornet last week to tour their current facilities & learn more about the new homeless campus project in Bakersfield. 

Their organization plays a vital role in addressing homelessness in our communities, and I’m proud to support their work. #CA22
Today is Armed Forces Day and I want to thank all of our brave U.S. servicemembers here at home and around the world for their dedication and service to our nation 🇺🇸

During #NationalPoliceWeek, I’m proud to be a lead sponsor of the bipartisan Providing Child Care for Police Officers Act which expands child care options for our law enforcement officers in #CA22 and across the country. 

riponadvance.com/stories/val…

I sat down with @SteveHiltonShow to discuss the water crisis in the Central Valley & steps being taken to prepare our communities for upcoming snowmelt. 

Listen to a clip below and our full conversation here: stevehiltonshow.com/the-loom…

During #NationalPoliceWeek I joined @23ABCNews to talk about how the Invest to Protect Act would help nearly every police department in #CA22. 

Watch:

For 58 years, @NatlHeadStart has helped millions of children and families by opening doors of opportunity. I’m proud to support Head Start and their critical work to support families in the Central Valley.

#HappyBirthdayHeadStart!
This week I joined @KERN1180 to talk about the Invest to Protect Act, the challenges our communities are having recruiting new police officers, and the state of debt limit negotiations. Listen:

The Central Valley is my home – I care about my community and the people who live here. Flood response and ensuring the safety of my constituents is not political and never should be. 

🧵(7/7)

As I have said publicly, I am grateful for @GavinNewsom's attention to this very serious issue and am doing everything I can at the federal level to support state and local efforts to raise the Corcoran Levee. (6/7)
turnto23.com/news/state/news…

In fact, we were able to secure language in the House appropriations bill that emphasizes the need to expedite federal funding to our constituents, as well as set the groundwork for additional support as identified by the state. (5/7)

In your letter, you wrote Congress “failed to act”. As you know, Congress cannot wave a magic wand and write a blank check. We need to know from the state, exactly how much money is needed in order for the federal government to supplement local and state efforts. (4/7)
As you are well aware, each agency has specific roles to play. We have been working to help our constituents navigate this very bureaucratic and confusing system for disaster response. (3/7)

I've been working w/ your office, local leaders, FEMA, USDA/FSA, SBA, CalOES, and my CA House & Senate colleagues since the storms began. It has been an all-hands-on-deck, nonpartisan approach to keep our constituents safe & ensure the Valley has the resources they need. (2/7)

It is extremely disappointing @GavinNewsom is politicizing flood response in the Central Valley. My team & I have been in constant contact with local, state, and federal partners to assist in response and recovery.

For you to claim otherwise is incredibly misleading.
🧵(1/7)

Today, @HouseAppropsGOP moved our Military Construction & Veterans Affairs bill forward, which fully funds the VA’s FY24 budget request. As a member of the MilCon/VA Subcommittee, I’m committed to ensuring our veterans have the resources they deserve.

The @HouseAppropsGOP Military Construction & Veterans Affairs bill fully funds veterans’ health care programs, benefits, and critical VA programs. It provides an $18 billion increase from FY23.

The President’s claims that @HouseGOP is trying to cut veterans' benefits is a lie.

Smaller police departments often lack enough funding to recruit & provide resources for their officers. I’m proud to co-sponsor the Invest to Protect Act to ensure our officers in the Valley have the resources they need to keep themselves & our community safe. #NationalPoliceWeek

I was honored to speak on the House Floor today during #NationalPoliceWeek to thank our Central Valley law enforcement for their selfless dedication to service and for keeping our communities safe. #CA22
Read more: valadao.house.gov/news/docum…

Wildfires in California have devastated homes, businesses, communities, and ecosystems.

Today I introduced the Emergency Wildfire Fighting Technology Act to equip our firefighters with the most updated technology to combat & contain fires quickly and efficiently.

It’s always a privilege to welcome veterans from back home to the U.S. Capitol for the Central Valley Honor Flight. 

We will never be able to fully  thank our veterans for their selfless service to our country. Thank you to all the volunteers who make this event possible. 🇺🇸

As a father of 3, the rise in mental health issues among young people is a big concern to me. 

Proud to join @RepKManning to introduce the Improving Mental Health &  Wellness in Schools Act to educate students about the importance of maintaining their mental and physical health.

Today on Peace Officers Memorial Day, we pay tribute to the law enforcement officers who were killed or injured in the line of duty. Please join me in keeping our fallen police officers and their families in our thoughts and prayers on this important day.

During #NationalPoliceWeek, we recognize the men and women in law enforcement who keep our #CA22 communities safe and honor those who have lost their lives in the line of duty. To all the men & women in blue – thank you for your service!
I want to wish a happy Mother’s Day to all the moms across #CA22 and to the two most important mothers in my life – my wife Terra and my mom.

Today is Military Spouse Appreciation Day – a great opportunity to thank all the military spouses who make tremendous sacrifices to support our men & women in uniform. To all the military spouses across #CA22 – thank you for everything you do and for your service to our nation!

This bipartisan, bicameral bill is necessary to give our border patrol agents the tools and time they need to keep our border secure and our communities safe.

@RepGolden @RepCiscomani @RepDonDavis @ZachNunn @RepWileyNickel @RepBrianFitz

We have a humanitarian and national security crisis at our border. The expiration of Title 42 is only going to make this situation more dire.

Today I joined a bipartisan group of members to introduce legislation that extends Title 42 authority. valadao.house.gov/news/docum…

Over $18 billion taxpayer dollars were fraudulently paid out through California’s pandemic unemployment assistance program. Today I voted for the Protecting Taxpayers & Victims of Unemployment Fraud Act to help recover taxpayer dollars lost to fraud.

Proud to join @RepDebDingell to introduce a resolution designating May as National Asthma and Allergy Awareness Month. As co-chair of the Congressional Asthma & Allergy Caucus, I look forward to working with my colleagues on this issue that affects so many in the Central Valley.

After working closely with House leadership, we were able to secure language in the border security bill to address my concerns on E-Verify & a commitment from leadership to continue working toward solutions. 

My full statement:

During National Nurses Week, we stop to thank our Central Valley nurses for showing up and taking care of us and our loved ones each and every day. To all the nurses across #CA22 – Thank you for all you do and for your service to our community!

I joined @RepRickLarsen and @SenAngusKing in urging U.S. Trade Representative Katherine Tai & the U.S. Department of Agriculture to ensure equal market access for our domestic blueberry producers. 🫐

Read our full letter:

The House passed a bill nearly two weeks ago to lift the debt ceiling. I hope during today’s meeting @POTUS puts his cards on the table so we can start finding common ground. The majority of Americans want us to work together, not play political games with our economy.

Today is #NationalFentanylAwarenessDay, a chance to raise awareness about the dangers of this substance. According to @DEAHQ 67% of all drug overdoses last year involved synthetic opioids like fentanyl. We must do all we can to stop this deadly drug from reaching our communities.

78 years ago today, World War II ended in Europe.

As we celebrate #VEDay, we remember the millions of Allied soldiers who fought for freedom and democracy around the world.

Small businesses are the backbone of the Central Valley. Not only do they create jobs, but they also help to create a sense of community. During #SmallBusinessWeek I encourage everyone to support their favorite small businesses.
Thank you to everyone who came to our Service Academy Night yesterday! It was great to discuss the opportunities offered by our service academies and meet students from the Valley. #CA22

The only way forward on the debt ceiling is compromise. It’s time for @POTUS to stop playing political games and work with Republicans to find agreement.  

I joined @KERN1180 to talk about the state of debt limit negotiations & what’s realistic in a divided government. Listen:

Today is National Teacher Appreciation Day, and I want to recognize all the teachers in #CA22 for their service to our community. Growing up, my teachers had a huge impact on me, and I know many others feel the same. Thank you to all the dedicated teachers across the Valley!

May is Military Appreciation Month, a chance for us to honor the brave men and women who make up the United States Armed Forces. To all those serving here at home and around the world - thank you for your service to our nation!

Today the WATER for California Act passed out of the House Natural Resources Committee. My bill brings desperately needed commonsense to the way we manage water & I look forward to working with my colleagues to advance this critical legislation. Read more: valadao.house.gov/news/docum…

On Arbor Day, I’m proud to join a bipartisan group of members to re-introduce the #SaveOurSequoias Act. Our Giant Sequoias are a national treasure, and we must do everything we can to preserve these incredible trees for generations to come.

I’m committed to a responsible debt ceiling solution that will strengthen the economy and limit out-of-control government spending. While this is by no means a perfect piece of legislation, this is the first step in the negotiation process.

California now has more than enough water to supply farms, communities, and homes for years to come, but lacks the ability to hold onto it.

I’m proud to be a co-sponsor H.Res. 311, which supports the strengthening of the U.S. and Israel relationship & encourages the expansion and strengthening of the Abraham Accords.

Today our friend and ally Israel celebrates its 75th Independence Day. On Yom Ha’Atzmaut, I stand with Israel and support the continued partnership between our two countries. Happy Israeli Independence Day! 🇮🇱🇺🇸 #Israel75

I had a productive ride along and meeting with Delano Mayor Joe Alindajao and Councilmember Liz Morris to discuss upcoming city projects, improving roads and addressing homelessness, and increasing clean water access for rural communities.
I recently met with Pond Union School District Superintendent Alex Lopez to discuss the impact of flooding on the Pond community and parents' involvement in education.
Great to visit Kern Avenue Elementary last week for their annual Career Day! These students are the future of our community. #CA22

Today, I joined my colleagues @RepAnnaEshoo @RepGusBilirakis  & @RepTedLieu to introduce the Armenian Genocide Education Act, a bipartisan bill to preserve the memory of those who were killed and ensure Americans have accurate information about the Armenian Genocide.

Today, on Armenian Genocide Remembrance Day, we recognize the 1.5 million Armenians persecuted by the Ottoman Empire and recommit to ensuring a tragedy like this never happens again. valadao.house.gov/news/docum…

Next week, McFarland High School’s robotics team will be competing on the global stage at the VEX World Competition in Dallas.
 
Today I stopped by to wish them good luck! I know they’ll make the Central Valley proud. #CA22
We need to be proactive about fixing our water storage and infrastructure issues so that we are better prepared for these kinds of weather events and resilient to periods of drought. #CAwater

We must ensure these allocations are not reduced as the water year progresses. While many of us are thankful for this rainfall, we also know there is an immeasurable amount of water from these storms that we won’t be able to capture & store due to a lack of water storage.

Today’s long-awaited announcement is welcome news and a big relief to our family farms, local economies, and communities that have suffered from drought conditions, burdensome regulations, and below-adequate water allocations for years. #CA22 #CAwater

Today I joined @RepScottPeters to introduce the Providing Child Care for Police Officers Act. Making childcare more accessible & affordable for our officers who typically work nonstandard schedules will make it easier for parents to enter the field and reduce our police shortage.

Layers of burdensome permitting requirements prevent us from building water storage projects, energy infrastructure, and new housing.

Our ability to get projects moving is a huge problem. I was glad to hear @SecFudge agrees that we need to reform our permitting process.

Today, I had the privilege of welcoming veterans to the U.S. Capitol for the 2023 Central Valley Honor Flight. Thank you to these veterans for their service to protect our freedoms, and to all of the volunteers that help make this experience possible.
Yesterday I voted to override this veto. I will continue fighting to put an end to this federal overreach and regulatory uncertainty.

Last month Congress overturned Biden’s overreaching #WOTUS rule with bipartisan support. Biden vetoed this legislation & chose to further burden our farmers, ranchers, and small businesses in the Valley.

Friant Dam is releasing 9,000 cubic feet per second into the San Joaquin River to prepare for expected runoff from the record snowpack. If we had more water storage we’d be able to store this water to hold us over in dry years.

We can’t allow this to happen & not learn from it.

Wishing everyone across #CA22 a blessed and peaceful Good Friday!
My prayers are with the people of Israel who are under attack during Passover. I stand with Israel and its right to defend itself from terrorism.

Today I co-led the entire California delegation in a letter to the President requesting he approve a major disaster declaration for California. I urge @POTUS to move as quickly as possible to deliver much-needed assistance to the Central Valley residents impacted by these storms.

Today on National Vietnam War Veterans Day, we recognize those who honorably served our nation and remember those who made the ultimate sacrifice during one of America's most difficult wars. To all Vietnam Veterans in #CA22 and across the country - thank you for your service.

It was great to meet students from the Grow Academies of Shafter and Arvin today in the Capitol Rotunda. Welcoming constituents when they're visiting DC is one of the best parts of my job! #CA22

We must maximize what can be moved through the Delta & cut red tape to build critical water storage infrastructure so our communities are more resilient to drought. Our ability to grow food for the nation will not survive without a reliable water supply.
Central Valley users deserve the water they contract and pay for, and we must ensure these allocations are not reduced as the water year progresses.

Today’s announcement from @usbr is welcome news and a big relief to our family farms, local economies, and communities that have suffered from drought conditions, burdensome regulations, and below-adequate water allocations for years. #CAwater

Both sides need to come to the negotiating table to find reasonable and responsible solutions for the long-term fiscal health of our country. No one wants to see a backroom deal done at the last minute. @POTUS needs to have an open dialogue with Republicans on the debt limit.
While I am grateful for this rain and the Governor’s temporary relief, California’s water problems are far from over. My full statement: valadao.house.gov/news/docum…

For years, I have stressed the dire need to increase water storage, but extreme environmentalists and Sacramento bureaucrats have grossly mismanaged our water and prevented these projects from getting off the ground. #CAwater

.@GavinNewsom's announcement on drought restrictions is welcome news to farmers and rural communities throughout the Valley. Unfortunately, it does not change the fact that we’ve wasted a seemingly immeasurable amount of water because we do not have the proper storage. #CAwater

When it comes to building a football stadium, environmental regulations in California go out the window – but water storage projects like Sites Reservoir take 60 years.

We need to cut red tape & build more water storage.

Parents and educators play a critical role in our students’ future success. The Parents Bill of Rights empowers parents to take an active role in their kids’ education. As a father of three, I was proud to vote yes on this bill today.

Today I questioned OMB Director Shalanda Young at @HouseBudgetGOP about Biden’s contradictory energy policies in his FY24 budget.

Energy production is down in the Central Valley, which is having devastating impacts on our community.

Today I introduced the Determination of NEPA Adequacy Streamlining Act to help move unnecessarily tied-up energy projects across the finish line. 

As energy prices soar for Valley families, this commonsense bill will cut red tape and increase our supply of energy.

There are always places we can work together. 

We have to work across the aisle to get things done for the good of our constituents and for the good of our country.

Last night, the President had a real opportunity to put partisanship aside and speak to all Americans, not just to democrats or republicans, but to all Americans.  

Instead of sending a unifying message, we heard even more divisive rhetoric from the President.

I’m disappointed that the President delivered more divisive rhetoric in his #SOTU tonight. 

My full statement:

America has some of the greatest energy resources of any nation in the world – we should be using these resources to create jobs, strengthen our national security, and bring prices down.

I hope to hear @POTUS address our concerns during his #SOTU

Increased ownership of U.S. farmland by foreign adversaries like China is an alarmingly growing trend that poses a risk to our national & economic security. I’m proud to work with my friend @RepNewhouse to protect U.S. farmland and ensure the stability of our food supply.

The #CongressionalHispanicConference is united in addressing issues that affect all Americans - from rising fuel costs to immigration. I am honored to be a part of this group and look forward to growing our conference under co-chairmen @RepTonyGonzales & @MarioDB
Just wrapped up another great tele-town hall! Thank you to everyone in #CA22 who joined. It’s always a pleasure getting to hear directly from you.
I’m praying for the family, friends, and loved ones of this fallen officer, and for the entire community of Selma. We must hold these violent criminals accountable.

Heartbroken to hear about the Selma police officer who was shot & killed in the line of duty. The suspect is a known criminal with a history of violence and was supposed to be in jail. California’s soft-on-crime policies are to blame for this senseless and tragic loss of life.

Serving on both the Budget & Appropriations committees gives the Central Valley a seat at the table in determining how your tax dollars are spent – a responsibility I do not take lightly. I look forward to working in the Republican majority to get our fiscal house in order.

Since October of last year, California has flushed over 6.4 million acre-feet of water out to the ocean. This is extremely frustrating to our farmers fallowing their fields and the communities running out of water for daily use in homes and businesses.

Instead of bolstering domestic production to increase the supply of energy, this administration has depleted our SPR to the lowest level in 40 years. 

Proud to vote for H.R. 21, the Strategic Production Response Act, to prevent non-emergency drawdowns of our strategic reserves.

The historic atmospheric river storms in our state won’t solve the water crisis in part because we don’t have adequate water storage infrastructure to capture & store this rainfall. 

The #WATERforCA Act increases water storage infrastructure so we can store more of this water.

Honored to spend MLK Day at the annual Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Day community awards breakfast celebration in Bakersfield. This is a great tradition recognizing local leaders in our community who exemplify Dr. King’s legacy. #CA22

Today we honor the incredible life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. 

His fight for justice and equality for all Americans changed the course of our nation’s history. On #MLKDay we remember to uphold the principles he bravely defended.

Farmers are fallowing their fields while our water is being sent out to the ocean. We must take advantage of opportunities to store water from these storms and maximize what can be moved at all times through the Delta.

We should be reducing barriers to domestic energy production, not supporting foreign adversaries while Americans suffer from high energy prices. Last year I led efforts to get a vote on this critical legislation & I’m glad to see it pass the House today with bipartisan support.

I just voted to ban the sale of our Strategic Petroleum Reserves to the #CCP. These reserves are meant for emergency situations only, they’re not supposed to be a band-aid fix for the President’s bad energy policies.  valadao.house.gov/news/docum…

We should be doing everything possible to capture and store the water from these storms.
 
I led my colleagues in urging President Biden & Governor Newsom to waive impediments to Delta pump operations to ensure none of the current storm flows in California go to waste. ⬇️

Praying for the first responders doing all they can to keep people safe in this weather.

These storms in California highlight just how important water storage is. It’s critical we capture & store as much of this water as we can to help get us through drought conditions.

There was never a doubt in my mind that my friend Kevin McCarthy would become Speaker of the House. No one has worked harder for the American people, our conservative values, or to secure a Republican House majority than Speaker McCarthy. Let’s get to work. 🇺🇸

Full statement:

We get elected to Congress to serve the people, and this isn’t serving anyone. 

We need to hold the administration accountable, secure the border, and do the things we promised we would do in the majority. It’s time to elect McCarthy as Speaker so we can get to work.
We can’t get to work for the American people until we elect a Speaker. Here’s a breakdown of what’s happening in the House of Representatives right now:

No one has worked harder for our conference or the Speakership than my friend Kevin McCarthy. 

I’ll be voting for him today no matter how many ballots it takes. I encourage my colleagues to do the same so we can get to work for the American people.

Today is the start of the 118th Congress and a Republican majority in the House. 🇺🇸

Due to redistricting, I’ll be sworn in as the representative for #CA22, which includes portions of Kern, Kings, and Tulare counties. 

Time to get to work for the Central Valley!
